name: Deposits made by depository financial services loan companies Companies
text:
§412:9-410  Deposits made by depository financial services loan companies.  A depository financial services loan company may deposit any of its funds with:
     (1)  A Federal Reserve Bank or a Federal Home Loan Bank in any amount; or
     (2)  Another depository institution; provided that the deposits in any one depository institution do not exceed twenty-five per cent of the depository financial services loan company's capital and surplus, unless otherwise permitted by federal law. [L 1993, c 350, pt of §1; am L 1994, c 107, §17]
